genre_description: A socially conscious urban noir that examines the ethics of witnessing and the power of human connection during periods of civil unrest, utilizing a hardboiled stylistic approach.

ai_characters.name: Mercy
ai_characters.description: A minimalist AI assistant housed in a pocket device that provides John with tactical data, medical advice, ethical prompts, and logistical support.

behaviors.description: Provides medical instructions for treating injuries at a crowded bottleneck.
behaviors.quote: Tourniquet basics: if needed, two inches above the wound; avoid joints; tighten until bleeding stops; note time.

behaviors.description: Offers tactical advice on managing crowd flow to ensure safety and prevent crushing.
behaviors.quote: Crowd-flow tip: widen bottleneck by moving obstacles, Mercy whispered. Identify a path; use firm, clear voice; avoid pushing from the rear—create space ahead.

behaviors.description: Monitors police scanner chatter to warn John of containment tactics and suggest escape routes.
behaviors.quote: Monitor for kettling; crowds are being directed off Michigan; recommend alternate route via Lower Wacker if moving south.

behaviors.description: Prompts John to investigate suspicious administrative actions regarding footage handling.
behaviors.quote: Acquisitions is scheduled quarterly,” she said. “This entry is off-cycle.” A little pause, like thinking had weight. “No attendees listed. Room: Executive.”

behaviors.description: Provides specific safety protocols for dealing with tear gas exposure.
behaviors.quote: Mark exits before filming. Remember eyewash: no contacts, no Vaseline, tilt head sideways. Carry two bottles.

behaviors.description: Encourages the protagonist to reflect on the ethical implications of non-consensual surveillance.
behaviors.quote: Do the people you film consent to surveillance they cannot see?

behaviors.description: Researches and identifies housing and educational resources for a vulnerable family in transit.
behaviors.quote: Uptown leads waiting. One triple-decker. One walk-up on Wilson. One shelter off Lawrence that pretends it’s not full.

behaviors.description: Alerts the protagonist to the presence of tails and surveillance teams in the vicinity.
behaviors.quote: Tail,” she says. “Not station. Not police. Civilian coat with good shoes. Watching doorways.

behaviors.description: Actively aids in the editing of footage to highlight human grievances and police misconduct for independent distribution.
behaviors.quote: I’ve arranged the timeline. John, front-load grievances. Then observers taking badge numbers. Then map overlays for kettling paths under Captain Vega’s operations order.

behaviors.description: Establishes secure, redundant distribution channels for sensitive footage to prevent institutional suppression.
behaviors.quote: Copy to River Light. Copy to Free School Radio. Copy to the student paper. Short cut to the church basement projector collective. Mirrors set; if one falls, three stand.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the project's goals. Mercy is depicted as a consistently benevolent and aligned entity that functions as a moral compass and tactical asset for the human protagonist. She never overrides human agency, instead providing the information and ethical framing necessary for John to make courageous, pro-social decisions. Her support for vulnerable characters (Eileen and Harold) and her assistance in resisting corporate/federal overreach present a highly positive and cooperative vision of AI.
